title: Drawing, "Personification of Africa", before 1720
medium: Pastel on paper mounted on canvas
provenance:
Laurence Currie, Coombe Warren, Kingston Hill, Surrey [1]; Estate of James Hazen Hyde; 1960: acquired by Museum















[1] Sold London, Christie's, December 17th, 1926 [Lot 134] for 168BP, the lot of four pastels [1960-1-7-a,b,c,d]
creditline: Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde
description: Bust length figure of a black woman, her right breast exposed and holding a scorpion in her right hand. She wears a turban decorated with feathers and jewels, pearl pendant earrings and a close-fitting pearl necklace. Her body is tilted forward and her gaze is directed to the left.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Personification of Africa", before 1720. Pastel on paper mounted on canvas. Gift of the Estate of James Hazen Hyde. 1960-1-7-c.
